Package harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

Class TSeries

  • java.lang.Object
    • harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TSeries
  • public class TSeries
extends Object
    TSeries objects represent series of six cards made using all 90 numbers of the Tombola, thus having no equal number between them. Besides, There are also methods to compare cards of a series versus cards of another series, checking how is the maximum of equal numbers between cards or rows.
    Since:
    1.8
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Harry G. Potter harry.g.potter@gmail.com
    See Also:
    TMakeSix, ITSetFactory

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TSeries​(TCard[] cards)
      Create a TSeries instance using the 6 TCard objects passed as input argument.  Controls on conformity are minimal, for performance reason (see TMakeSix).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int compareByCard​(TSeries other)
      Compare each card of this series to each card of the other one, counting and returning the maximum equal numbers found between them. If this value is the highest even found for this or the other series, it is also stored internally the TSeries objects so that can be returned when requested invoking getCurrentMaxEPC() method.
      int compareByRow​(TSeries other)
      Compare each card of this series to each card of the other one, counting and returning the maximum equal numbers found between their rows. If this value is the highest even found for this or the other series, it is also stored internally the TSeries objects so that can be returned when requested invoking getCurrentMaxEPR() method.
      TCard getCard​(int index)
      Return the card in index position within the series
      int getCurrentMaxEPC()
      Return the maximum amount of equal number that has been found between a card of this series and a card of another series using the compareByCard(TSeries) method since the series creation or a call to resetCompareResult().
      int getCurrentMaxEPR()
      Return the maximum amount of equal number that has been found between a row of a card of this series and a row of a card of another series using the compareByRow(TSeries) method since the series creation or a call to resetCompareResult().
      void resetCompareResult()
      Clear the values stored as maximum equal number by card and by row during the comparisons.
      int verifySeries()
      Verify that there are no equal numbers between series cards.$nbsp;It requires that each single card is well formed by itself (see TCard.checkConformity()).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TSeries

        public TSeries​(TCard[] cards)
        Create a TSeries instance using the 6 TCard objects passed as input argument.  Controls on conformity are minimal, for performance reason (see TMakeSix).
        Parameters:
        cards - the array containing exactly 6, well formed, TCard objects

    • Method Detail

      • getCard

        public TCard getCard​(int index)
        Return the card in index position within the series
        Parameters:
        index - the position of card in the series, within [0..5] range.
        Returns:
        the card in index position within the series

      • getCurrentMaxEPC

        public int getCurrentMaxEPC()
        Return the maximum amount of equal number that has been found between a card of this series and a card of another series using the compareByCard(TSeries) method since the series creation or a call to resetCompareResult().
        Returns:
        the maximum amount of equal number found between a card of this series and another one until now.

      • getCurrentMaxEPR

        public int getCurrentMaxEPR()
        Return the maximum amount of equal number that has been found between a row of a card of this series and a row of a card of another series using the compareByRow(TSeries) method since the series creation or a call to resetCompareResult().
        Returns:
        the maximum amount of equal number found between a row of a card of this series and the row of another card until now.

      • compareByCard

        public int compareByCard​(TSeries other)
        Compare each card of this series to each card of the other one, counting and returning the maximum equal numbers found between them. If this value is the highest even found for this or the other series, it is also stored internally the TSeries objects so that can be returned when requested invoking getCurrentMaxEPC() method.
        Parameters:
        other - The series to compare whit
        Returns:
        the maximum equal number found between the cards of the two series

      • compareByRow

        public int compareByRow​(TSeries other)
        Compare each card of this series to each card of the other one, counting and returning the maximum equal numbers found between their rows. If this value is the highest even found for this or the other series, it is also stored internally the TSeries objects so that can be returned when requested invoking getCurrentMaxEPR() method.
        Parameters:
        other - The series to compare whit
        Returns:
        the maximum equal number found between the rows of the cards of the two series

      • resetCompareResult

        public void resetCompareResult()
        Clear the values stored as maximum equal number by card and by row during the comparisons.

      • verifySeries

        public int verifySeries()
        Verify that there are no equal numbers between series cards.$nbsp;It requires that each single card is well formed by itself (see TCard.checkConformity()).
        Returns:
        -1 if there ane no equal numbers between cards, the index, between 0 and 5, of the first card of the series having at least one number equal to a number in another card.
